oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Union veteran John Frazier re: his pension claim
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alexander's brother, Qtm. Sgt. John Fr[asure] served in Co. B, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA. he writes his brother asking for him to testify on behalf of his application for a pension based on war disabilities, particularly an injured eye due to faulty discharge of a gun at Camp Nelson, KY on January 1, 1864. The injury is plainly visible in his photograph in cart038. The brothers alternately spelled their name Frazier, Frasier or Frasure.
